title: What are the similarities of media literacy and information literacy? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think of it (and teach it) as the difference between a payload and the rocket/delivery system used to deliver it. Information literacy is understanding the payload/message being sent to you (Buy this product, be for/against a political party). Media Literacy is understanding the methods by which that message is conveyed (for example, using a camera shot upwards so you look up to and admire the spokesperson). They overlap quite a bit (logical fallacies), but this is a rudimentary way to understand the difference, and both are necessary skills to deconstruct messaging. BTW, did you notice that, in addition to answering your question, I inserted an ethos technique of persuasion by casually mentioning I teach this (to make my answer have more weight, though I actually do teach it). That’s media literacy!
